title: What is the best tablet for an autistic child? - Quora

response.answer_text: If it’s possible, I would take them to the store and let them try out some of the ones on display. I’m on the spectrum, and I know the experience of using a device really matters to me. The way the tablet looks, feels and operates will be a big part of whether or not they enjoy using it. Personally, I do tend to prefer Apple products because they’re simple to use, have a clean interface, and their construction is really satisfying. I’d say an iPad wouldn’t be a bad place to start. You’ll want a case and screen protector since they are a child, and will probably drop it. I recommend tempered glass screen protectors if your child prefers the way glass feels. Plastic screen protectors have a different texture, so I wouldn’t recommend them unless they dislike the glass. With the case, it’s definitely a matter of which textures they enjoy. Once again, I’d really recommend letting them pick it out if possible. All in all, it really comes down to their preferences. Everything is about the experience when you’re on the autism spectrum. You’ll want them to enjoy how the tablet feels, that way they can use it comfortably.

Do you mean to cure Autism? There is no cure. I suppose some symptoms could be toned down with medication, but that could have side effects considering it’s unnatural. Or maybe you mean the easiest type of tablet for an autistic child to take? When I was little, medication was easiest to take when it was in a super surgery syrup. Sometimes I could stomach it when it was dissolved, but it wasn’t until I was bout 12 that I could actually take pills. You probably know the child best. Are they intolerant to the texture? the taste? You can always talk to a doctor to find something that works for you.
